bibl.title: Letter from Frederick L. Hoffman to the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine, December 7, 1928 [Enclosed in C0323045]

div1.p: Hoffman asks that he be sent copies of certain reports published by the Yellow Fever Commission.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick L. Hoffman to the Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine, December 7, 1928 [Enclosed in C0323045]
div1.opener:
December 7, 1928
The Incorporated Liverpool School of Tropical Medicine,
Liverpool,
England.
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
We have in our library Volumes I and II of the “Reports on
questions connected with the Investigation of Non-Malarial Fevers in
West Africa” published under the direction of the Yellow Fever Commission
of which J.K. Fowler was the chairman.

We also have the third, fourth and final Report of the Yellow
Fever Commission itself.

We are now under the impression that there was a third in-
vestigation report which is supposed to contain the results of “Bacot's”
work on the life history of “Stegomia fasciata” from 1914 to 1916, we
believe.

It would also seem that we are still missing the first and
second Reports of the Yellow Fever commission, assuming that the In-
vestigation Reports of this Yellow Fever Commission and the Reports of
the Yellow Fever Commission itself are two separate and distinct sets
of reports. If this is the case, will you be good enough to send us to-
gether with your bill, all the reports which would seem to be required
to complete our set, after comparing the complete set with what we al-
ready have, as stated above.

Will you please give this request your early attention and
oblige.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, F.L. HOFFMAN Consulting Statistician
